climbs.name: Bullets before Breakfast
climbs.fa: Reg Smart, David Smart, John Kaandorp, June 20, 2020

content.description:
Pitch 1, Climb the rib to a ledge with juniper.

Pitch 2, Cross a gully on the right, traverse a ledge until a couple of steep moves lead to the belay.

Pitch 3, Climb the wall above the Lucky Ledge

Pitch 4, Steep groove blocked by a chockstone, and a slab lead to bolts just below top

Pitch 5, Scramble couple meters to huge North Channel Ledge, and follow flagging tape 70m to left to a bolt belay at end of ledge.

Pitch 6, Exposed climbing up a wall to a ledge with two prominent trees that have been hit by lightning.

Pitch 7, Easy climb to very top of cliff.



Left side of Riverside Rock, where prominent vertical wall rises 75 m at its highest point to a large forested ledge (The North Channel)

Bring 12 draws and a 70 metre rope if you want to descend by rappel. Alternatively, hike down.

Pitch 1, start up a short wall with 3 bolts leading to an optional anchor just below the big ledge.At the roof near the end of the pitch, step left and down to belay.

Pitch 2, Follow bolts up and left over roofs through a scoop to a mantle. Traverse left several meters to anchor.

Pitch 3, Follow bolts to a rightward traverse, then over the roof. This pitch puts you on The Balcony

Pitch 4, Starts several meters to the left in a groove with a large pine tree at your back. Followw bolts up and left; avoid using the old tree. This pitch puts you on The Porch. Continue 2-3 m up and right to anchor bolts left of a large flake

Pitch 5, Traverse right and climb onto the flake. Follow bolts out right to a left facing layback flake. Head up back left of the arete finishing to the right around the final small roof. This puts you on The Attic

Pitch 6, Exit pitch leading to the top of the cliff. Anchor bolts are located climbers left on a small rock face 20 cm above the ground



Start is approx. 25 m right of The Stars at Night on a short face below a large ledge. The right side of this feature is a major right facing corner made of black rock with a wide crack.

12 quickdraws plus 4 alpine draws

climbs.name: Long May You Run
climbs.fa: Brandon Pullan, Reg Smart, David Smart 2021

content.description:
Pitch one: Short gully to a small crux (5.10a)

Pitch two: Good incuts to a steep face (5.10b)

Pitch three: Wandering features to a small roof (5.10b)

Pitch four: Good crimps left into awkward wall (5.10d)

Pitch five: Fun and featured, left around roof with tricky jam (5.10+ or 11a, jury is still out)

Pitch six: Short but tricky corner to the top (5.9)

Descent: Walk off trail to the right



Up the tallest most continuous part of the wall on the right side of the main cliff.

18 quickdraws, 60-metre rope, helmets.

climbs.name: The Stars at Night
climbs.fa: Randy Kielbasiewicz, Rafael Kolodziejczyk, Daunte Rezaie, September 5, 2020

content.description:
Pitch 1, Stick clip the first bolt. Follow bolts past a couple of roofs and grooves and exit right to a stance at base of chimney-like feature on right.

Pitch 2, From anchor, follow bolts left and climb groove on left side of arete, then cross over the arete back right into the top of a chimney. Head up corner to a large ledge.

Pitch 3, Climb up groove on right to a slab, past a flake system, up to a bolt, past a grassy ledge with rings. Faceclimb to a right traverse. Follow layback system to anchors on left.

Pitch 4, Follow flake system until blocked by a roof, move right around the roof. Climb up steep overhanging face exiting through a right-facing dihedral onto a long narrow ledge. Traverse left across the Balcony to a much wider platform called the Terrace.

Pitch 5, Climb up and right to the next small edge.

Pitch 6, Follow bolts up corners and slabs to a top-out on a ledge system with rappel rings.



Left most route on Lookout Wall

Bolts and rap rings

The Shotgun is a long and variable cliff section that runs along the river on the North side of the logging road about a kilometre past the Fortress wall. The main section is upwards of 150m tall, includes several quality multi-pitch routes which are fully bolted and currently holds Ontario’s tallest! 

BE AWARE: LOOSE AND SHARP ROCK IS COMMON AT THIS CLIFF!!! CLIMB WITH CAUTION AND MANAGE ROPES WITH ATTENTION WHEN DESCENDING. NEW ROUTE DEVELOPMENT IS ONGOING AND MAY CURRENTLY BE UDERWAY IN ANY OF THESE AREAS. RED TAGS ARE SOMETIMES BUT NOT ALWAYS PRESENT.
